alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 16 at 9:30PM EST until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains have ended over the area. However, there is another area of heavy rains over the interior areas of Palm Beach County that could move into the advisory area during the next hour as the steering flow start to shift more southwest. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible with this area of heavy rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 1030 PM EDT this evening for Palm Beach metro areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Wellington, Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Lake Worth, Riviera Beach, Palm Beach, Juno Beach, Greenacres, Royal Palm Beach, Palm Springs, North Palm Beach, Lantana, Lake Park, Atlantis, Haverhill, Cloud Lake and Golden Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
